channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 10 Best Coffee Pod Machines We Tested for Lickety-Split Caffeine Delivery (2025)
item.description: Pod coffee makers are a convenient way to get caffeinated. Of the ones we've tried so far, the Bruvi BV-01 is our top pick.

item.title: Teen founders raise $6M to reinvent pesticides using AI — and convince Paul Graham to join in
item.description: Bindwell applies AI drug discovery techniques to invent new pesticide molecules.

item.title: LinkedIn adds AI-powered search to help users find people
item.description: LinkedIn's AI-powered people search is rolling out to premium users in the U.S.

item.title: Harbinger raises $160M, will build trucks for FedEx
item.description: The Los Angeles-based startup will build more than 50 electric truck chassis for the delivery giant by the end of this year.

item.title: EU launches antitrust probe into how Google’s anti-spam policy affects publishers’ search rankings
item.description: The Commission said on Thursday that it had identified that Google is using its spam policy to push news media and other publishers' websites and cont...

item.title: Jackrabbit MG Doble Review: Powerful, But Not Bike Path Legal
item.description: Don’t let this micro vehicle’s mini façade fool you. It’s powerful.

item.title: OpenAI’s Open-Weight Models Are Coming to the US Military
item.description: The gpt-oss models are being tested for use on sensitive military computers. But some defense insiders say that OpenAI is still behind the competition...

item.title: AI Relationships Are on the Rise. A Divorce Boom Could Be Next
item.description: Secret chatbot flings are creating new legal challenges for married couples when it comes to infidelity.

item.title: Cash App debuts a new AI assistant that answers questions about your finances
item.description: Cash App is adding a map to its app to let users discover places that accept bitcoin

item.title: Sam Atlman-backed Exowatt wants to power AI data centers with billions of hot rocks
item.description: The solar-thermal startup wants to deliver electricity for as little as one cent per kWh. But first it has to scale production to 1 million units per ...
